Clover has a far nicer UI than the other free ones in my opinion.

 

(and clover has just been purchased by Atlassian - the makers of JIRA,
Confluence, Bamboo - and they have a lot of motivation to improve the
product further!)

 

 

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of C
Chen
Sent: Tuesday, 21 August 2007 10:18 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] code coverage tool Java

 

We are using emma (open source) and Clover, both are
great.
--- avinash anand <avinash_anand@ <mailto:avinash_anand%40yahoo.co.uk>
yahoo.co.uk> wrote:

> Can anyone suggest a good code coverage tool for
> Java code. Does JUnit has testing code coverage
> capability.
